articles.description: Authorities say the first employee to test positive for COVID-19 within the Brown County Sheriff's Office is a jail correctional officer.
articles.content:
GREEN BAY, Wis. (WBAY) -- Authorities say the first employee to test positive for COVID-19 within the Brown County Sheriff's Office is a jail correctional officer.

articles.title: Coronavirus: How does COVID-19 affect the body? In more ways than you think, doctors are finding - WSB Atlanta
articles.description: While scientists first believed the COVID-19 virus was one that attacked only the respiratory system, they have come to find out that the new coronavirus is not a one-note disease.
articles.content:
While scientists first believed the COVID-19 virus was one that attacked only the respiratory system, they have come to find out that the new coronavirus is not a one-note disease.

articles.content:
PARIS, France (AFP) — Every week, it seems, the list of coronavirus symptoms — ranging from disagreeable to deadly, from "COVID toes" to toxic shock — grows longer.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: New Mexico woman, 105, who beat 1918 flu, has COVID-19 - KOB
articles.description: Lubica "Luby" Grenko was diagnosed on April 29.
articles.content:
The Gallup-born Grenko was born when World War I began, then she survived the 1918 flu before enduring the Great Depression and World War II.
The flu took the lives of her mother, Marijeta Kauzlaric, 28, and younger sister, Annie Kauzlaric, 1 month old.
